step1.sentence: She was accepted to the program because she is the cream of the crop among this year's applicants.

step2.story: Every year, the firm only hires the cream of the crop from top universities. This year, Marcus stood out with his exceptional portfolio and sharp problem-solving skills. He received an offer before he even left the interview room.

step3.story: The national science competition drew thousands of students from across the country, but the judges were searching for the cream of the crop. Among the finalists was Yuna, a seventeen-year-old who had spent two years developing a low-cost water purification device. Her project was elegant, practical, and backed by solid data. When the results were announced, her name came first — by a wide margin. Standing on stage, she realized that all those late nights in the lab had been worth it.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 수확물 중에서 위로 떠오르는 크림처럼, 무리 중 가장 뛰어난 것을 뜻한다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 사람이나 사물 중에서 최고 수준에 해당하는 것을 가리킬 때 사용한다. 채용, 경쟁, 선발 맥락에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 우유를 가만히 두면 지방이 풍부한 크림이 표면에 떠오르는 현상에서 유래했다. 18세기부터 '최상급'을 의미하는 비유 표현으로 쓰이기 시작했다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적인 어감이 강하며 다소 격식체에 가깝다. 경쟁이 치열한 상황에서 특별히 선별된 대상을 강조할 때 적합하다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Only the cream of the crop gets invited to this exclusive workshop.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 이 독점 워크숍에는 최상위 인재만 초청된다.
